website_summaries.verdict: The Mighty Vibe's audience is limited to Spotify Premium users, but it's an appealing little music player for those looking for an iPod Shuffle-like device to wear on the go and leave their phone at home.
pros: The Mighty Vibe is a tiny music player with an integrated clip that stores downloaded Spotify playlists and podcasts
It has built-in Wi-Fi and Bluetooth, so you can use it with Bluetooth headphones and speakers
It's good for runners who don't want to carry a phone around to listen to music
There's a headphone jack for wired headphones
cons: Bluetooth headphones are supposed to automatically re-pair, but some models may require manually re-pairing

customer_reviews.title: Cool concept, terrible execution
customer_reviews.text: I happy set up my new Mighty, connected to Spotify, loaded my playlist and tested it at the house. Everything worked beautifully. Fast forward 12 hours to the gym. I turn the device on, connect to my AfterShokz headphones, and... It won't play. I get a repeated "Spotify login expired, please reconnect" message from the Mighty. I reconnected to Spotify multiple times through the Mighty app with no luck. It *seems* as if the Mighty must have access to wifi to connect to Spotify before it will play. Someone please tell me how this is useful when I'm outside or in any other location without wifi? What's the point? #FAIL
customer_reviews.author: W. J. Maselunas

customer_reviews.title: Don't recommend
customer_reviews.text: I hestiate to give a product only 1 star. But if I can't sync my playlists after multiple tries/reatarts/work arounds then the device is completely useless. This should be good to go soon after getting it out of the box and syncing up with the app. Super expensive tiny piece of plastic. I regret the purchase and looks like I will have to wait until after the weekend and maybe holiday as well for any customer service response. I think if this were like 25 bucks I wouldn't be so upset. But spending almost 100 for this little thing? Yeah, I'm pretty upset. Wouldn't recommend unless they can come up with a prompt resolution.
customer_reviews.author: Wildflower

customer_reviews.title: Flat out doesn't work,  poor customer service
customer_reviews.text: My Mighty never connected to my phone (Galaxy S7). I contacted customer service 3 weeks ago and they have shown no interested in solving the issue. They send one email a day and though I've asked multiple times to Skype or do a phone call to troubleshoot and fix the problem, they've resisted. Three weeks after contacting customer service and talking to them almost every day and no solution? No thank you. I was very excited about the product when I received it... that excitement is long gone. I'm returning it.
customer_reviews.author: simon

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.text: If you love Spotify and have even the slightest inclination to detach yourself from your phone every once in a while, then Mighty Vibe is a must have. I bought the first Mighty as well. So far, this bad boy packs the same great functionality with noticeable improvements on Bluetooth connectivity and battery life. One of the best purchases I’ve made in a long time—highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin Y.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for leaving the devices elsewhere
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my teenage son so he could listen to his music without having his idevice in his bedroom. This is perfect for that! He uses headphones/earbuds that plug in, so no issues there and the sound is decent. Haven't tried any blue tooth devises yet. He didn't have any issues syncing his spotify with the Mighty Vibe and he loves the size. I also love the size and plan to get one for myself since apple discontinued the nano and its support (grrr). I hate having my phone on me during workouts. Overall happy so far.
customer_reviews.author: RockArt

customer_reviews.title: Died after 1 week
customer_reviews.text: This is the second try after not being happy with the first. The last one i lost, this one died after having it a week, to much sweat. My waterproof ipod i can swim with works fine. Ill reiterate my last rant from the last spotify player i purchased. It has poor battery life, no more then 4hrs. Not water resistant for out running in the rain or taking in the sauna. Its marketed as disconnect device from your cell phone, but it requires a cell phone to upload the music through an app. DO NOT BUY this piece of junk....your warned.
customer_reviews.author: travis newton

customer_reviews.title: The worst customer service on any device, hands down
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this device for myself and was planning on purchasing for my kids. It could be a super cool device but there is no customer support and if you device doesn't work properly there is no human/phone number or response from customer support. So, pretty much makes your device worthless. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Cool concept! Take your music with you without the distraction of a phone!
customer_reviews.text: We live with our phones attached (sometimes literally) to our hip and MP3 players have largely disappeared in favor of smartphone streaming apps. Most (myself included) to not keep an updated MP3 library anymore - just playlists. I received this neat little product as a birthday gift - it's simple and it works well. It reminds me of simpler times. I also enjoy the lack of a visual UI because most of my Spotify usage is random anyway. Plus it's small and fits easily in a pack or waistband for bike rides and runs!
customer_reviews.author: Evan

customer_reviews.title: Horrendous Bluetooth
customer_reviews.text: Terrible Bluetooth technology and reliability. It’s a great idea but the device is not ready for mass usage and it this product does not work with AirPods even after a software push. Really awful experience and not at all worthy money
customer_reviews.author: rbrad

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work
customer_reviews.text: We ended up returning this because we couldn't get it to work correctly - and we're tech savvy. It's not ready for the marketplace. At $83 it's WAY too expensive, but if it worked it was worth it for my 9 year old to listen to his music - but it doesn't. He was VERY frustrated with it (and I couldn't get it to work properly either). If it worked well, it really should only cost $30, not over $80. Do yourself a favor and skip.
customer_reviews.author: Scott C

customer_reviews.title: Short battery life!
customer_reviews.text: I was really excited to get this is in the mail. As a runner, a lightweight music player makes great gear. However, the first time I tried running with my new Mighty Vibe after about 15 minutes of play it cut out. 5 minutes later it cut back on again and played music for another 10 minutes and that was it. Already it needed a recharge. I had max charged it the day before the run so I am very unsatisfied. This product is DISAPPOINTING!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It really fills the need
customer_reviews.text: I see a surprising number of 1 star reviews. I know how frustrating it is when a device just doesn't work, and other reviewers chime in with "gee I never have that problem". It looks like Mighty has had more than it's share of setup and configuration issues. But for me, it's working fine. It's a bit expensive, and takes so long to boot up you'll wonder if it's running Windows 95, and the setup confused me at first; but it connects smoothly to my Amazon account and synchs my playlists, which is fantastic. And it's a nice small package for running. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: jim hughes

customer_reviews.title: Best bluetooth work out device ever!
customer_reviews.text: Yaasss! This device is perfect! I have had many different bluetooth devices for working out but this one tops them all. The signal is never lost or cuts out while running or working out. That fact that you can download Spotify playlists is genius! Will buy again for sure!
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Nefzger

customer_reviews.title: The Mighty Vibe maybe the best iPod Shuffle Replacement and a dang cool Spotify player
customer_reviews.text: This is an amazing device that holds 1000+ Spotify or Amazon Prime Music Songs. plus it also acts as an iPod Shuffle as well. The only thing I like to see is a better longer Battery life and add Local File Support for MP3, Flac, AAC, and other music files I buy from CD, Amazon Music or iTunes. Plus more Song Storage for 10,000 songs of Spotify's Offline limit. Still pretty amazing and convenient and a great help for not wasting batteries on a smartphone like Samsung Galaxy a51 and Apple's iPod Touch Product Red 256gb. Amazing gift and cool colors.
customer_reviews.author: Jo-ann Furstman

customer_reviews.title: Small but powerful
customer_reviews.text: Great for runs. Don’t have to lug a big ol phone when running and just clip and go
customer_reviews.author: Lori Stelly

customer_reviews.title: Great for running
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to run without my phone. I have music on my watch but the bluetooth is spotty and it blows through my watch batter. It serves its purpose well. I notice that on startup the sound is usually all slowed down and choppy for like 10 seconds. Doesn't happen on other devices to same headphones so it's something with the Mighty. Doesn't really bother me. After that it works great, and it's small enough to clip on my shirt. I've worried if clip isn't strong enough but so far it's never moved a bit from where I clip it on.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Reader

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for kids w/o a Smartphone
customer_reviews.text: Gpt this as a birthday gift for our 12 yo daughter. She doesnt have a phone but wanted grequent portable music for during distance learning, in her room and on walks. Synced to my Spotify on an Android device easily and held up great with good battery life.
customer_reviews.author: B. L. Custer

customer_reviews.title: Total Garbage
customer_reviews.text: I got this for my son for camp. I made all the playlists on Spotify and perfectly followed the directions to set up. It keeps telling it won't sync to my spotify account. I emailed the company and got a reply saying that Spotify updated their servers and that I need to go to the App store and download the latest version... 2.12. The app store only has 2.11. So this was a total waste of my time. In theory it seems awesome, but it's just stinks and was a waste of money and time. I am sending it back.
customer_reviews.author: Juny

customer_reviews.title: Save your money
customer_reviews.text: Just awful.... The few times I've actually tried to use the device, I've ended up having to spend hours troubleshooting. I've had issues connecting to the device from the app, syncing music, and even once songs are synced, I've had issues playing the music from the device. I bought it to workout with and I'd like to just pick up the device and go on a run, but end up having to fiddle with it. This is one of the most frustrating devices I've had experience with ever and it's nowhere close to worth the price tag. Was a nice idea in theory though.
customer_reviews.author: Micah

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my baby’s bedroom so that we could play lullabies and nature sounds on a speaker without having to leave a phone in the room. In principle the idea of the mighty player is good but it has massive problems and glitches. I spend up to 20 minutes each time just trying to get it to connect to the app. The player never once has easily connected. It has become so frustrating we stopped using it. So disappointed!!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie Booker

customer_reviews.title: Super Portable and easy to use
customer_reviews.text: My daughter loves this little gadget. She clips it to her pants and does her chores, homework or exercises with it. It was easy to set up and download songs to. We also had no problem connecting Bluetooth headphones. It is light and tiny.
customer_reviews.author: M. E. A.

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids as it doesn't require wifi access
customer_reviews.text: So as a conservative parent, we don't want our kids to have all the access in the world and have greatly limited "devices" the kids have. This was a great option so they could chill with their own music with no wifi connection. Really appreciate this as an option.
customer_reviews.author: easygoing

customer_reviews.title: Do not buy
customer_reviews.text: This product is awful. Takes 10 minutes to connect to WiFi, then you have to connect to Bluetooth headphones as well. After only 4-5 uses, this product no longer will connect or work at all. So much for being phone free on runs!
customer_reviews.author: Erin

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE - NIGHTMARE
customer_reviews.text: This is a complete waste of about 5 hours of our time attempting to pair it and have it play. What a nightmare and we both are highly educated tech people. We finally got the bluetooth going, the wifi, I downloaded Amazon Music, and paired the headphones. Then, it simply wont play. Tried everything. After 5 hours its time to pack this piece of garbage and send back. Best of luck to whoever gets this.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: WILL. NOT. SYNC.
customer_reviews.text: I was so excited to have found this product, but unfortunately had to return it. I tried and tried and tried to sync it with my Amazon music. It just plain wouldn't sync. The spinning circle thing just spun around for HOURS as I tried to sync various playlists with as few as four songs in them. Tried different playlists and tried everything that customer support suggested. Yes, they did respond to my emails. But alas, the Mighty tried mighty hard and in the end not one song synced onto the device. I have a Samsung Galaxy S9 btw. I had no choice but to return this thing. :(
customer_reviews.author: Girlie Girl

customer_reviews.title: Very functional
customer_reviews.text: Had an Apple mp3 player, the small postage sized device that is no longer made by Apple, that finally wore out. Looked online, found this Mighty player. A little bit larger than the Apple product, but still able to do the same job. Getting the device to finally hook up via Bluetooth to your phone can be frustrating at first, but it eventually will work. Downloading music from Spotify was very easy. The battery life is so-so. I work out daily for around an hour, and after 3 days, the device will signal it is getting low. Easy recharge in about an hour. Overall, well worth it !
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's a nice little unit!
customer_reviews.text: At first I was skeptical to get this, based on the reviews. But I'm really glad I got it. It's the right size, and I can just transfer music straight from Amazon music. But, playlist has to be available to listen online. It has to connects to wifi to transfer, so you need wifi to put music on it and bluetooth. I haven't figured out why though. Luckily I have wifi. It only holds a thousand songs though. Which I guess you only need that many to get through it's battery life anyway.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: My daughter loves this!
customer_reviews.text: It's great for kids that just need something to rock out with. Good form factor, easy to set up and use.
customer_reviews.author: iPad/Iphone User

customer_reviews.title: Mighty is its name, and mighty it is!
customer_reviews.text: Difficult to load with music and delete and add others, but sounds well, small, great battery time. Overall love it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Bluetooth connectivity and clunky. Upgrade please.
customer_reviews.text: Buggy Bluetooth, clunky controls, poor blue tooth connectivity, illogical charging system. The idea of this player is amazing. The execution is terrible. The Bluetooth connection is clunky and poor. It’s not intuitive at all. The case is plastic and feels cheap. Sound wise it’s ok but probably could be better.
customer_reviews.author: Awinter6

customer_reviews.title: Little device perfect for playing music when you’re out and about
customer_reviews.text: If you’re like me and don’t like having to take your phone with you everywhere, this is a great little device to have to play music while you’re running or walking. Just sync it up with Spotify premium, charge it, and you’re good to go! I just clip it to the bottom of my shirt . Good sound quality using my little earbuds.
customer_reviews.author: Kristyna

customer_reviews.title: Essential for camping when wi-fi is not an option
customer_reviews.text: I just purchased my Mighty Vibe a week ago in anticipation of an upcoming camping trip. Filled it up with playlists and songs from my 90-day free trial Amazon music unlimited account. Paired it with my Bazooka party bar on the sidde-by-side and with my just-purchased JBL Extreme 2 portable loudspeaker. Everything worked without a hitch, and the sound quality is amazing. Can't wait to go into the woods. This little item is going to transform the entire experience!
customer_reviews.author: Hugh Mungas

customer_reviews.title: Save your money, trust me
customer_reviews.text: This is the absolute worst product I have ever bought. First thing thats wrong is the instructions that come with are extremely lackluster. Second is when you download the app, the app will not get passed step one. I cannot login through Facebook or the app itself. This was EXTREMELY disappointing and I'm returning it immediately
customer_reviews.author: luke e.

customer_reviews.title: I really wanted to love this thing but its an expensive, hyped up piece of junk.
customer_reviews.text: I am returning it. It won't stay connected to the app when I am trying to sync, it won't sync even a single song and because of that I have no way of determining if it is even connecting to my wireless headset. At almost $100 for a utility music player, I expected ALOT more functional performance coming out of the box. Instead I have an expensive piece of plastic I can't even use as a paperweight. I am returning it and never trusting an Amazon specific product again. You wouldn't believe how disgusted I am. Its a simple music player. How the hell do you screw that up?
customer_reviews.author: Mz Thang

customer_reviews.title: This works exactly as advertised!!!
customer_reviews.text: This truly is a “mighty” amazing product. It is exactly as advertised and works perfectly for me. I downloaded all of my Spotify playlists and linked to both Bluetooth speaker and wireless earbuds. I liked so much that I bought another for family member. Used my iPhone 7 Plus and other family member using iPhone 10 to sync and download from and both work seamlessly and perfectly. Looking to get your Spotify account music downloaded and listened to without having to use your phone, then this is the device for you.
customer_reviews.author: Millennia44

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for running
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why so menu reviews were meh for this. It’s perfect. Love it. Easy to pair with my phone to sync my Spotify. Easy to pair with my wireless earbuds. Sounds great. Easy to use. Is secure on the waistband of my running shorts. Light weight. Instructions from the app are helpful in learning operations. Quite nice. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: LGreen

customer_reviews.title: Absolute piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I have become accustomed to the quality of apple products. When I realized that the shuffle wasn't made anymore, I ordered this for my daughter. It didn't even consistently turn on, let alone play music. I returned it and got a replacement thinking that the first one was a lemon. The second one was the same. Do not buy!
customer_reviews.author: Taryn S.

customer_reviews.title: Haaa... the design is cool but...
customer_reviews.text: 1. The sound quality is not that great, high frequency sounds which really annoying, I would except it to have an Equalizer options to choose from. 2. Super slow when you skip between songs. 3. Not playing all the songs in the playlist- I tried turning off shuffle and even then it was playing only around 30 songs out of 73 I had on my playlist and it was sooooo slow to skip between them. The only good thing is the size - super light and very comfortable to workout with it.
customer_reviews.author: Roy

customer_reviews.title: Unit came DOA
customer_reviews.text: Unit came dead on arrival. A replacement unit is on its way and I'll update this review barring the success of the replacement unit. At this point I am thankful for Amazon's swift action in regards to this by sending out a replacement unit without any hassle. I'm more concerned all the negative reviews on this unit might be justified. Hopefully the replacement unit actually works!
customer_reviews.author: 9k

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup, works great.  Battery life not very good but still a nice player.
customer_reviews.text: Easy to setup. You plug it into the wall and let it charge full. Then leave it plugged in and download the app. It will connect and update through your phone. Then you log in with spotify credentials and choose playlists you want loaded on it. Does NOT come with headphones. It can use bluetooth or wired headphones.
customer_reviews.author: Jocho Jay

customer_reviews.title: Good idea, didn't last
customer_reviews.text: First 2 weeks it worked perfectly. Connected to my Spotify, synced my playlists, and connected to bluetooth headphones. Super easy set up, honestly was confused by ask the bad reviews. 2 weeks of use later when I charged it up it started to over heat, the solid white light got stuck, it stopped playing music completely and would not connect to app whatsoever. Save your money until better options come out or if you are really active just spend a bit more for a smart watch that connects to spotify for your workouts. Battery wasn't up to par either, lasts about 3-4 hours with constant use. Never hit anywhere close to 5 hours.
customer_reviews.author: Cristian Ayala

customer_reviews.title: DON'T BUY THIS
customer_reviews.text: One star is too generous.... I just bought my second mighty. The previous one (generation 1) I had worked for a few weeks after an extremely cumbersome setup process and then died. Customer service is horrible and after multiple re-installs of software decided to trash it. I thought the second generation, the mighty vibe, would have fixes. At least, that's the big promise on their website. Alas, it is again a total disaster. The people who develop and commercialize this should be ashamed of themselves. Either they are utterly incompetent or Theranos-like corrupt. This product is not ready for commercialization.
customer_reviews.author: FredO

customer_reviews.title: “Good enough for now”
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Does work away from WiFi and syncs with Spotify PREMIUM playlists after a setup Cons: Doesn’t always sync to Mighty App. Takes practice working the buttons. Recommend cord over Bluetooth headset. Overall: Very limited but “good enough for now”. I hope new, better versions come out in the future. Still better than bringing a phone and all the distractions that come with it.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Annoying at times
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if it's Mighty's fault, or if it's Big Brother Spotify, but I find that I have to re-establish the link between my Mighty and my Spotify account over and over again.. Almost invariably, this happens just as I'm about to step out on a run -- I'm laced up, ready to go, and I turn Mighty on and it tells me I have to reconnect to the mother ship and refresh the downloads of all my music -- which takes a while. So I end up leaving it at home and picking up my iPod Nano (!) instead. Apparently, using the Mighty takes advance planning.
customer_reviews.author: PNW cat

customer_reviews.title: Pain to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up as long as you agree to all of the app requirements. I found it annoying that everytime I used it I needed to connect my phone to the internet, turn on bluetooth, and location services. Then connect to the mighty. It took a while to sync my 900+ song playlist. One time it unloaded my sync sonic had to do it twice. Found myself not using it. Wanted to return it but it's over a month past the deadline.
customer_reviews.author: charles williams

customer_reviews.title: Replaced Apple Shuffle For Spotify.  Does The Job For Running!
customer_reviews.text: Have been an Apple Shuffle fan for years, but really wanted to be able to run with Spotify. Running with a phone is a drag. Cycling has not been a problem because I could put my Android in my Mule. Did my first run today and was very satisfied with the Mighty. As unobtrusive as the Shuffle. Paired with Soundcore Spirit X headphones and was more than adequate for a workout. Time will tell, but my first impression was all "5-star".
customer_reviews.author: Rob, Danbury, Connecticut

customer_reviews.title: Doesn’t sync playlists easily or at all- returned it
customer_reviews.text: After numerous attempts over a one month period trying to sync Spotify playlists to the Mightvibe during initial set up, we finally gave up and returned it. We were never able to sync ANYTHING, it just sat at 0% sync for over 20 minutes. We tried several times on different days using wifi from different sources and-no luck. We paid for the Spotify premium membership to be able to use Mightvibe but it didn’t matter. Returned and getting an IPod Touch instead.
customer_reviews.author: A Amiri

customer_reviews.title: Update: flaky
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my 7 and 10 year old boys. They do exactly what I want them to do. They sync with your Spotify Playlist. I was searching for this exact device because my kids love listening to their play lists but I didn't want them using my phone or iPad. Update: these are flaky when it comes to syncing and connecting with Bluetooth and Wi-Fi. They also all of a sudden wipe all the music off and need to resync. This was a surprise and a pain when we were on a car trip and didn't have access to Wi-Fi. I wish I could return but it's too late and I've bought two. Really disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Christina

customer_reviews.title: waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Very good idea, but still not a good product. Less than 3 hours of battery life if you use a wireless earphones. Quality sound is terrible if you use wired headphones. Not all the headphones works with mighty vibe. I don’t live in USA, so I couldn’t return this product. Waste of money!!
customer_reviews.author: Patricia

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I wanted. Simple to use and no issues.
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I wanted. 30 year old guy here that just had his iPod shuffle die last week. Hated running with my phone. Stumbled on this with Amazon searches. Charged it up, downloaded the app and it synced no problem. I have Amazon prime music and it just worked. Synced a few playlists for offline use through the app and off I went. The only thing I'll have to get used to is that it doesn't have as great a tactile feel compared to the shuffle but I can get over that.
customer_reviews.author: Mischa Pesicek

customer_reviews.title: No phone needed...spotify player!
customer_reviews.text: Awesome! Easy setup and download. Left my phone at home today and still had my Spotify at the gym. It announces your playlists by name and the sound quality is ++++. From what I read recently, its not healthy always having your cell phone in the pocket. That is the reason I bought this little player. It delivered exactly what I wanted!
customer_reviews.author: Jeepdrew22

customer_reviews.title: Convenient but had many issues with Bluetooth pairing
customer_reviews.text: Mighty is a great idea for those of us who don’t want to carry around their phones all the time while working out. The ability to access Amazon Music is a great benefit. However, I had too many problems pairing the device with Bluetooth headphones. The pairing worked during set-up (although it took a number of tries) but then “disappeared.” I was never able to pair the Mighty with Powerbeats Pro despite many attempts. Unfortunately I was forced to return the product.
customer_reviews.author: D. RATH

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.text: I had a very frustrating experience with this device. The app is terrible. I got my music to sync once, and then I kept getting a message that said I wasn't logged in to Spotify. Which wasn't the case.
customer_reviews.author: Aurora

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Product ☹️☹️
customer_reviews.text: Terrific Idea, Absolutely Terrible Product along with Crappy Customer Support. Have spent more time then I should have with Tech Support in trying to correct the problems with the Mighty, I've had Two!!! Needless to say both lasted about a year with problems throughout with Battery Life in both getting to the point that it was useless. Spend your money elsewhere!!!!!!
customer_reviews.author: James

customer_reviews.title: Great player.
customer_reviews.text: I almost didn't get this because of some negative reviews, in turn I must post this positive one. It was easy to setup, I also followed directions on you tube video. I love that it syncs my playlist for water aerobics and gym. Sound is great and it's easy to use. So far, so GREAT. Add: I've been through countless devices so I was disillusioned with trying this but glad I purchased it. Thanks Cynthia
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia

customer_reviews.title: COMPLETE WASTE OF MONEY!
customer_reviews.text: This product did not and will not sync with ANYTHING like the instructions say it will. After two hours of trying to sync my spotify lists I came to the conclusion I waisted my money. Major disappointment....I hate giving it even one star considering I dont even know if it's capable of working!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: As a marathon runner, this is it!!!!
customer_reviews.text: For 3 decades I have used various music playing devices. Getting music on them was always a huge mess. Running with a phone on your arm is not an option at the speed I run. This thing is perfect, easy to use and access to millions of songs on Amazon music is cool. Pros- easy to use, easy to put music on, simple and effective, blue toothed to airpods made it really great Cons- downloaded play lists of music dont mix with others so you cant shuffle ALL the songs. No battery life display.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa E. Meredith

customer_reviews.title: Inadequate Customer Support.
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my daughters. One of them is working fine but the other stopped working after 3 1/2 months. I emailed Mighty directly and was sent an initial email within 24 hours but then the responses were days in-between after telling me that we had a defective unit they stopped returning my emails. I was trying to be patient considering with Covid response time could be slower but it has been about 6 weeks since my first email. I wouldn’t buy this product due to the lack of support, if an issue comes up. Paying $80 and for it to last only 4 months is disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Gena Gatson Jacobs

customer_reviews.title: Purchased so I was not tethered to my iPhone
customer_reviews.text: I specifically purchased this product so they I could sync my Spotify account and not be tethered to my iPhone. I was going on a trip and wanted something that I could easily bring to the beach and not have to bring my expensive iPhone. This product is awesome and exactly what I need. The only thing I would say is understanding the navigation of the buttons to turn it on, turn it off, navigate playlists etc. I didn't do my homework of learning those buttons in the manual so I kind of just pressed around until something happened. That is more user error. Overall great product. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Russ B

customer_reviews.title: Back to the drawing boards, fix sound interruption
customer_reviews.text: So we were really excited to get this gadget bc my boyfriend hates running with a phone and this was a cool alternative. He loved the idea of being able to load Spotify songs on it and have it connected to his AirPods. The downside was that if he’s holding it while he runs the sound quality or connectivity is very poor. The sound will go in and out equivalent to when you had an old CD player skipping. We contacted the manufacturer and they said it was normal and that to have it as close to the blue tooth devise as possible. Hats a tad difficult when your jogging, are you supposed to attach it to your shirt collar?
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca Dobry

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this thing
customer_reviews.text: Simply don’t buy it ! It’s crap! It stoped working after 3 months and the costumer service is awful and stressful! Save some money and buy other options that are much better.!
customer_reviews.author: Cristian

customer_reviews.title: Changed my running game!
customer_reviews.text: I love this little workhorse! Like many others, running is a form of meditation for me. To that end, bringing my cell phone on workouts with me proved problematic and bothersome: for one, I would check my phone any time a text, call, or alert came through, thereby disrupting any state of calm I could find. Secondly, while I love my large phone, its size poses practical transportation problems during exercise. Cue the Mighty: this device completely changed and liberated my workout. I love knowing that I can hop out the door with free hands and no obligation to check my phone. Ultimate freedom in today's technology-driven world. Can't recommend enough!
customer_reviews.author: Yasmin

customer_reviews.title: Overpriced, not easy to use, but handy.
customer_reviews.text: It never stays paired and won't recognize the app or my phone. That makes it hard to add music or remove music. Since there is no screen you can't see what's playing or look for songs when you use it. Once you get it to work, it is lightweight and it's nice that you can use Spotify this way. However it should be a lot cheaper given the downsides.
customer_reviews.author: Marie

customer_reviews.title: Be Patient. It Works
customer_reviews.text: Ok so first you have to follow instructions and read everything it says. You must not have more than 5 devices on your spotify account or it wont work offline. You have to reconnect to WIFI every 30 days to keep your account synced. But so far so good works like an MP3. I leave my phone back home when I go jogging in the morning and no problems.
customer_reviews.author: RSG_COMPANY

customer_reviews.title: Unsatisfied with the mighty, I would love to return it!
customer_reviews.text: Every time I want to use it, there is an issue, either connecting with the Wireless headphones or having to refresh the music playlists. You need your phone to connect every time, I bought it to avoid carrying my mobile while running, but not really useful, I have had to use the phone to refresh the playlist from spotify and connect with the headphones again...
customer_reviews.author: Julio Romo

customer_reviews.title: Ignore the bad reviews...this thing is great
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous with a lot of the bad feedback, but this thing is exactly what I was looking for. When I first took it out for a run, it was skipping a stalling a decent amount. BUT, when I clipped it on my shirt instead of my shorts, it worked great! So nice to be able to leave without my iPhone + on my runs. I had seen bad reviews about the clip, but mine is very sturdy. Also, the syncing is seamless with Spotify. If you're on the fence - pull the trigger!
customer_reviews.author: Skyler Adams

customer_reviews.title: Awful!!! Stopped working after about 20 days
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for summer camp (one month long) in a place without my phone. Not only did the battery life suck, but also after 20 days the device started saying "Spotify login failed, reconnect to app". Because I was unable to connect it to my phone, I could not use it for the rest of the 10 days. I did not see this anywhere on the Amazon description. There were other people at the camp that had the same exact issue as me.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonCustomer

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids
customer_reviews.text: If you have a kiddo who isn't ready to have internet acces, Mighty is a great option. In our case, our 15 year old has shown us that he isn't ready to have a cell phone, so we went on the hunt for something he could listen to music with that didn't have the option to connect to the internet. We found Mighty and decided to give it a try and so far, it's been fantastic. Set up is easy and linking to Spotify is a breeze. So, if you are looking for a music player without internet access, I highly recommend Mighty.
customer_reviews.author: Megan

customer_reviews.title: Nah.
customer_reviews.text: I do not like this product. I don't synch things every night, and don't feel like I should be forced to. However, if I don't, one morning the thing will tell me that it won't work until it can reverify my spotify account. It's always in a time when you're not home, or not near a place you can do it, and then you go without. I delt with it once or twice and then got fed up. It sits in my bag ing unused. I don't have time for that crap.
customer_reviews.author: Amos J.

customer_reviews.title: When you're having a party and the phone call ruins your playlist.
customer_reviews.text: This will never happen if you use Mighty Vibe. I love playing spotify playlist on my outdoor bluetooth speakers but hate being restricted of always keeping my phone next to the speakers. Now since all of my favorite playlists are downloaded on the Mighty, I don't have to remember to download the songs on my phone before heading out camping without cell phone reception. Also now I can carry my phone with me and always know that my playlist will be playing all throughout the night. As for the battery issue, I keep it plugged in a portable usb battery and it will play all night long. You can download hundreds if not thousands of songs.
customer_reviews.author: Abby Schnauzer

customer_reviews.title: Great with a few rough edges
customer_reviews.text: The execution of setup and syncing is a bit clunky, but I love it. It changes the way I listen to Spotify, I feel like I listen to music more and skip less, which is a nice feeling - I get to enjoy the music instead of being distracted by my phone.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron Harmon

customer_reviews.title: Great little player for Amazon Music offline.
customer_reviews.text: Bought for our daughter since we’re not getting her a phone but we have Amazon music and she would like to listen to music while she does homework/reads. Relatively easy to set up. Battery life plenty long for a couple workouts. Charge indication isn’t great, but great product for what it is.
customer_reviews.author: Valerie Cornell

customer_reviews.title: Good, but could be great with better battery life
customer_reviews.text: UPDATED: Lowering my rating. Firmware 2.5 was pushed out, and things went downhill. With firmware 2.3 the physical volume buttons on Powerbeats Pro worked. Every physical control worked. With 2.5, you can no longer control the volume from the earbuds. This means you have to use the tiny little buttons on the Mighty, and you'll end up skipping tracks instead. Their customer service tells me you can't roll back to a prior firmware, and they're not interested in fixing this. They said they didn't think the controls ever worked. Can't recommend this if they're not interested in keeping features alive when they push out firmware updates.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nightmare of problems to get connections
customer_reviews.text: My first mighty worked great for a few months then suddenly would not connect to wifi. Contacting mighty support for help is awful (email only and days just to get fixes). They couldn't fix my wifi issue so they did send me a new mighty. The new mighty connected to wifi with no problem but WOULD NOT CONNECT TO MY SPOTIFY account! Spent a full month and hours in attempting to fix. Multiple email games with support team and no fix. The software issues are awful and making what should be a good product a useless one!! It simply isn't worth the time, effort and aggravation just to get the device to actually work!
customer_reviews.author: JOEL FERNANDES

customer_reviews.title: Works exactly as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Pretty much works exactly as advertised and what I was looking for. Setup can be maybe a little clunky, but only a tiny bit. Overall super satisfied with the purchase. Will give it to my niece who is not allowed any screens!
customer_reviews.author: Aman Pervaiz

customer_reviews.title: Massive headache
customer_reviews.text: Setup and connecting is an absolute headache but once it's done it seems to work fine. Will update if that changes. Update: -1 star for the battery only lasting 4 hours from full charge not the 5+ as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Jake Wall

customer_reviews.title: Does exactly what is advertised
customer_reviews.text: When looking for a way to play Spotify at the gym, this little player seemed to be the perfect fit. After reading some of the reviews, I was concerned that it would have ton of bugs and be a waste of money. That could not be farther from the truth. I have had no issues with the player or the setup. In fact, set up look less than 15 minutes. I am not sure what issues other people are having but it appears to me that it would be user error. I highly suggest getting one of these to lessen distractions when at the gym.
customer_reviews.author: Nolan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome ideas. Has far to go...for $80??
customer_reviews.text: Awesome idea. I am a long time Spotify user. But there is a lot to want with device. Battery time, fragile product, carrying case, has to re sync alot, the app had a lot of stall and feels like a lot of work. I feel like I'll have to buy a new one soon ..I haven't even dropped it once and it's already acting slow:/. Very disappointing after a couple of weeks. But the idea is great. I hope there will be a better long lasting model near the same price or with a warranty.
customer_reviews.author: meg agni warren

customer_reviews.title: Look at the YouTube video for setup
customer_reviews.text: The streaming is very easy, but the setup instructions are ambiguous. A picture could have shown touching the + to start setup is on the Mighty App not the + on the device. The sound is great. I charge the device every three days after three or four hours of use.
customer_reviews.author: Crash

customer_reviews.title: Use a wired headset.
customer_reviews.text: The app for this music player(which you have to have to be able to use it) is one of the most unintuitive things I've ever had the misfortune of using. It will just straight up not sync or pair with bluetooth accessories for no reason. I've spent too much time turning bluetooth on and off, closing the app, opening it back up, anything to try and get devices to appear. I've even restarted my phone and this is not smooth sailing. Do yourself a favour if you get this, just get a wired headset.
customer_reviews.author: Nimcha

customer_reviews.title: Almost There...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased and returned it after a few days because it keeps disconnecting. Maybe an update on its firmware will solve the issue. How I love to listen to my Spotify Playlists but if it's keeps disconnecting it defeats its purpose.
customer_reviews.author: Hoi.its.wil

customer_reviews.title: Complete Garbage
customer_reviews.text: You will spend more time trying to add music to it than you will ever spend listening to it on a run. Its a tiny box of pure frustration. Can someone please build one of these that doesn't suck?
customer_reviews.author: Ben

customer_reviews.title: Terrible Bluetooth Support
customer_reviews.text: I've lost so many runs/workouts futzing with this device. If you're not willing to run a dedicated bluetooth audio device for this (that you ONLY pair with the Mighty) then this could work, otherwise you spend hours in aggregate trying to get bluetooth devices to repair as the bluetooth is near unusable. App/UI aren't helpful and the device (Mighty) is so clocked down (slow CPU) that a lot of actions have LARGE amounts of lag in them (e.g. 5+ seconds of feedback after an action) which makes troubleshooting even harder. Take my advice and look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Intermittent audio when running
customer_reviews.text: I bought this device despite the bad reviews, thinking that they were exaggerated. Unfortunately this device is not usable for running as the Bluetooth connection interrupts for a second everytime my feet impact the ground. The clip on the device is just not strong enough to hold its place on my pocket. This could be great but the execution and quality is substandard. Would not recommend for working out.
customer_reviews.author: L. L

customer_reviews.title: So here's the deal
customer_reviews.text: I couldn't figure out why some reviews said you needed a phone and others seemed like they didn't. 1) You do need a phone to sync/copy playlists to the device. 2) You don't need the phone to play the files AFTER they've been copied to the device. That's it, that's all you really need to know.
customer_reviews.author: Ara Winters

customer_reviews.title: Meh...
customer_reviews.text: Perfect size just like the shuffle. I have Amazon Music so worked perfectly with it. I didnt like the fact my wireless headphones started losing connectivity after putting the Mighty in my pocket. BIG negative to me! For that I think the price should be at least $10 - $20 cheaper. Lol
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: Great present for music lover.
customer_reviews.text: It was a requested birthday present by my son-in-law. He loves music while he runs and just in general. Was very excited to get this.
customer_reviews.author: Stellasgrandma

customer_reviews.title: Waste of time and money
customer_reviews.text: This product will not upload playlists after a lot of work trying to do so. I have followed the correct instructions to no avail. It has horrible issues connecting to bluetooth and wifi even when you are directly beside each. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: RMomma

customer_reviews.title: Sluggish boot, Can last hours on a charge. Perfect podcast companion.
customer_reviews.text: Got a Mighty for Christmas and love it. The boot time is a bit sluggish and can make you think it's broken if you don't have patience. Battery last several hours and can be extended if using Bluetooth audio and use charging cable to a battery pack. If on charger will auto sync podcasts via wifi while in parking lot so every day I have fresh content without having to open the app.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: Worth It! Leave Your Phone At Home
customer_reviews.text: I just bought one and set it up yesterday. You don’t even have to download your music to have “offline access”, you just save it to a playlist that syncs with the mighty player from the app (i use amazon music). When i take it for a run i can leave my phone at home and it worked fine (no wifi and no phone), bluetooth headphones are setup thru app. This little thing is fricking amazing. I would highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: AF

customer_reviews.title: Not easy
customer_reviews.text: Very difficult to work out. Follow all steps. Downloaded all app they told . Pairs and pairs. Not for me. Give up!
customer_reviews.author: Andie

customer_reviews.title: Spotify without your phone. Great for running and working out.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I love to run long distances with music, but hate carrying a phone. It takes a little getting used to, but take time to read the instructions and you'll love it. I got all my favorite Spotify playlists and podcasts on this tiny device without any of the bulk and annoyance of an armband or smart watch. Yes, this thing will shuffle your playlists! (Hold down the playlist button for two seconds) Freedom!
customer_reviews.author: Travis

customer_reviews.title: Bluetooth suckss
customer_reviews.text: The thing works as it should but bluetooth is beyond horrible. Takes forever to connect to already paired headphones. When it's in my pocket bluetooth is unusable. Just putting it in my closed fist losses entire bluetooth signal. Its good that I can also use wired headphones or this would be for sure returned. I really wanted it for bluetooth so low rating. Also liked the tim leary reference in the instructions. Maybe drop less acid and focus on making a solid bluetooth product. Edit: a couple days later bluetooth is non existent, no longer connects to app making it useless.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Hunt

customer_reviews.title: Difficult to connect to wifi - no customer support
customer_reviews.text: I bought this a week ago and still have not been able to use it. I’ve contacted support several times with no response. The device will not connect to WiFi - I provided the serial number needed to obtain the MAC address and have yet to hear back. This was supposed to be a gift and now I am forced to return and find an alternate very close to Christmas. This is very disappointing.
customer_reviews.author: Ginger N. Mills

customer_reviews.title: Good idea but still not there
customer_reviews.text: Idea is good but missing way too much development, even though it’s their second version the app is super slow, transfer new music takes forever and sync mobile/app/WiFi/earbuds is almost a mission.
customer_reviews.author: Hernán

customer_reviews.title: Still in Beta.  Maybe forever
customer_reviews.text: This is my 2nd time giving the Mighty a try. I bought it when it initially came out and it was a bomb. I was back and forth with customer service at least five times with two different units until I just gave up. Sad to say, a year later it's no better. It's completely undependable, works on it's own whim and has a nasty habit of deciding that you have too many devices using Spotify. Oh, and forget working out with it. Any sweat anywhere near it and it's toast. All this for nearly $100. Like another reviewer said, I'd be a bit more ok if it was $25.
customer_reviews.author: Kay, NYC

customer_reviews.title: Poor durability- broke in 2 months
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my 11yo daughter’s birthday in January and by March the case was cracking and split and falling apart, requiring an insurance claim and refund. She only used it while playing outside, it was not dropped. The case cracked simply from the buttons being pressed. Very poor durability. If you buy this get the insurance!
customer_reviews.author: The Misfit Nurse

customer_reviews.title: Great player, wrong color
customer_reviews.text: It's a great little music player. My oldest son (10 years old) has the blue one. I like that his dad and I can have some semblance of control on what he listens to. It's a great way for a kid to get his feet wet in independence when it chimes to music. I love to use it, too, in order to workout. The only problem I have is that I ordered the red one for my second son, and I recieved the black. It's too late to send it back and get the red one before Christmas. My son will still love it, but it won't be quite as special.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Ragsdale

customer_reviews.title: Not Perfect but when it works, its great
customer_reviews.text: slow to connect to headphones and will occasionally drop the connection. After it stays connected, It works great. Very simple to setup and sync your playlists from Spotify. I wished it also worked with other music services, such as Google Play Music.
customer_reviews.author: scott

customer_reviews.title: So far so good
customer_reviews.text: I've had the Mighty for about 9 months now and its worked well for me. I pretty much use it every time I do a cardio workout at they gym about 3 times a week. I change my workout playlists pretty often and syncing with the Android app has always gone smoothly. Also, it is definitely waterproof! I know this because I forgot to take it out of my gym pants and it ended up going through the washer and drier! Gave it a full charge and it's been working as usual 4 months after the laundry incident.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

product_meta.title: Mighty Vibe Spotify and Amazon Music Player - Bluetooth & Wired Headphones - 1,000+ Song Storage - No Phone Needed - Blue
product_meta.description: Color:Gully BlueMighty Vibe is new and improved with a bigger battery life, more stability, and improved Bluetooth playback. Mighty is the first ever Spotify music player. It's created for athletes, as it's small, lightweight, durable and clips onto anything. It works with your Bluetooth or wired headphones, holds 1000+ songs, and has 5+ hours of continuous playback. Mighty requires a Spotify Premium subscription and includes headphone jack to USB charging cable and mobile app. For support, please reach out to us, bemighty.com/contact.
feature_bullets: 5+ HOURS OF SPOTIFY AND AMAZON MUSIC PLAYLISTS & PODCASTS OFFLINE - Mighty plays your Spotify and Amazon Music playlists and podcasts offline without a phone, screen, or Internet connection. No data or WiFi is needed for playback - leave your phone at home and take your streaming music anywhere.

BLUETOOTH COMPATIBLE - Mighty works with all Bluetooth headphones, speakers, and car entertainment systems. Pair Mighty with your Bluetooth accessory and it will automatically reconnect each time you want to listen to your music, no phone needed. Mighty works with wired headphones too.

WIRELESS SYNCING - Use the Mighty mobile app to wireless sync your playlists and podcasts to Mighty, no cords or computer needed. Our Stay Fresh feature automatically updates your playlists while you sleep so you have fresh tracks every morning.

SMALL & LIGHTWEIGHT - Mighty clips onto any piece of clothing, is smaller than a box of matches (1.4” x 1.4”), and lighter than four quarters (0.7 ounces). You won’t even notice that you’re wearing it...just you and your Spotify music, finally.

DURABLE & KID FRIENDLY - Water, sweat, and drop resistant. Mighty’s screenless design and physical buttons makes it the perfect companion for any workout and for your kid’s playtime. No more broken smartphone screens.
